label: EXCLUSIVE DANCE HELD BY SOPHS IS A SUCCESS

resource.chars:
EXCLUSIVE DANCE HELD
BY SOPHS IS A SUCCESS

To the syncopating strains of
Carl Van Sickler’s Old Liners danc-
ed in Ritchie gymnasium Saturday
night, an exclusive Sophomore
class. Breaking all traditions of the
University, Hie Sophs successfully
carried the ■ dance through the
evening witaaut molestation from
from any otner classman contiaiy
to rumors that there would bo raids
by Freshmen and Juniors.
Each Fraternity and Sorority was
represented by a banner bung from
ibo sides of the balcony. Directly
in the center of the farther end of
the gym hung the large 1928 Em-
blem of green and white. Colored
lights added to the beauty of Hie
decorations.
At eleven fifteen refreshments of
ice cream and cake were served in
the basement and at eleven thirty
dancing was resumed until twelve
thirty. Among those from the
faculty who were present were Miss
Adelle Stamp, Miss Pearl Anderson,
H. C. Byrd and Burton Shipley.
U. of M.
